title: Understanding the Concept
text: In statistics, a variable is a characteristic or attribute that can assume different values. Think about what X represents in this context.

title: Types of Statistical Terms
text: Consider the definitions of the following terms: - Variable:∗∗ A characteristic that can take on different values. - Statistic:∗∗ A numerical measurement describing some characteristic of a sample. - Parameter:∗∗ A numerical measurement describing some characteristic of a population. - Data:∗∗ The actual values of the variable.

title: Identifying the Correct Term
text: Given the definitions, which term best describes X, the number of days a student is absent?
